original_text: Subsequently, the narrative transitions, as we learn that the saints... shall take the kingdom (Verse 18).
prompt: 970 A detailed image of the saints taking the kingdom, during the day, taken with an Canon EOS C300 Mark III camera, using a Canon CN-E 85mm T1.3 L F lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: The saints, often derided, reproached, persecuted, and cast out, deemed the least likely among all ever to realize their aspirations, are the ones who shall seize the kingdom and possess it eternally.
prompt: 980 A detailed image of the saints seizing the kingdom and possessing it eternally, during the day, taken with a Blackmagic URSA Mini Pro 12K camera, using a Sigma 18-35mm f/1.8 DC HSM Art lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: The wicked's usurpation and maladministration shall cease. The inheritance lost due to sin shall be reclaimed. Peace and righteousness shall perpetually preside over the vast expanse of the renewed Earth. Truth of the Fourth Beast.
prompt: 990 A detailed image of peace and righteousness perpetually presiding over the renewed Earth, during the day, taken with a Canon EOS C500 Mark II camera, using a Canon CN-E 50mm T1.3 L F lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: Daniel possessed a lucid understanding of the first three beasts in this vision. However, the fourth beast astonished him due to its unnatural and fearsome nature.
prompt: 1000 A detailed image of Daniel astonished by the unnatural and fearsome nature of the fourth beast, during the day, taken with a ARRI ALEXA Mini camera, using a Zeiss Supreme Prime 85mm T1.5 lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: It was primarily concerning this beast and its ten horns, particularly the last emerging little horn whose look was more stout than his fellows, that he sought additional information.
prompt: 1010 A detailed image of Daniel seeking additional information about the beast and its emerging little horn, during the day, taken with a RED RANGER GEMINI camera, using a Cooke Anamorphic/i 75mm T2.3 lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: The lion, as a creature of nature, must have two wings added to represent the kingdom of Babylon.
prompt: 1020 A detailed image of the lion with two wings representing the kingdom of Babylon, during the day, taken with a Sony FX9 camera, using a Fujinon MK18-55mm T2.9 lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: Likewise, the bear is found in nature, but to symbolize Medo-Persia, an unnatural ferocity must be denoted by the three ribs in its mouth.
prompt: 1030 A detailed image of the bear with three ribs in its mouth symbolizing Medo-Persia, during the day, taken with a Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Pro, using a Sigma 24-70mm f/2.8 DG DN Art lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: Similarly, the leopard is a natural creature, but to accurately represent Greece, four wings and three additional heads must be incorporated. However, nature offers no symbol capable of aptly illustrating the fourth kingdom.
prompt: 1040 A detailed image of the leopard with four wings and three additional heads, representing Greece, during the day, taken with a Panasonic Lumix S1H camera, using a Leica Vario-Elmarit-SL 24-70mm f/2.8 ASPH lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: Consequently, the vision introduces a beast, the likes of which had never been seen before: a dreadful and terrifying creature with brass nails and iron teeth, so barbarous, rapacious, and fierce that it devoured, shattered, and trampled its victims beneath its feet, solely out of love for oppression.
prompt: 1050 A detailed image of the dreadful and terrifying beast with brass nails and iron teeth, during the day, taken with a Canon EOS C300 Mark III camera, using a Canon CN7x17 KAS S 17-120mm T2.95 Cinema Zoom lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: As astounding as all this was to the prophet, there was an even more remarkable feature that captured his attention: a little horn emerged, and true to the nature of the beast from which it originated, displaced three of its counterparts.
prompt: 1060 A detailed image of the little horn emerging from the beast and displacing three counterparts, during the day, taken with a Sony PXW-FX9 camera, using a Zeiss CP.3 XD 35mm T2.1 lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: Behold, the horn possessed eyes—not the unrefined eyes of a brute, but the keen, shrewd, and intelligent eyes of a man.
prompt: 1070 A detailed image of the horn with keen and intelligent eyes like that of a man, during the day, taken with a Blackmagic URSA Mini Pro 12K camera, using a Sigma 50-100mm T2 Cine FF Zoom lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: Stranger still, it had a mouth that uttered haughty sayings and advanced outrageous and arrogant claims.
prompt: 1080 A detailed image of the horn with a mouth uttering haughty sayings and arrogant claims, during the day, taken with a RED KOMODO camera, using a Zeiss Supreme Prime 135mm T1.5 lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: It is no wonder that the prophet inquired specifically about this monstrous entity, so unearthly in its instincts and so fiendish in its actions and ways.

original_text: In the subsequent verses, some details are provided regarding the little horn, enabling the student of prophecy to apply this symbol without the peril of error.

original_text: The extraordinary wrath of this little horn against the saints particularly captivated Daniel's attention.

original_text: The emergence of the ten horns, or the division of Rome into ten kingdoms between AD 351 and 476, has already been discussed in commentary on Daniel 2:41.

original_text: Since these horns represent kingdoms, the little horn must also symbolize a kingdom, albeit of a different nature, as it was distinct from the others.

original_text: They were political kingdoms, and thus, one must inquire if any kingdom has arisen among the ten divisions of the Roman Empire since AD 476, which was dissimilar to them all; and if so, which one?
prompt: 1140 A detailed image of the dissimilar kingdom that arose among the ten divisions of the Roman Empire, during the day, taken with a Sony FX9 camera, using a Sony FE 24-105mm f/4 G OSS lens with cinematic lighting --v 5.1 --ar 16:9

original_text: The answer is the spiritual kingdom of the papacy. This power aligns with the symbol in every detail, as we shall observe in due course. Daniel saw this power waging war upon the saints.

original_text: Has the papacy engaged in such a war? Countless martyrs affirm this fact. Consider the brutal persecution of the Waldenses, the Albigenses, and Protestants in general by the papal authority.

original_text: Gazing forward from the time when the little horn was at the height of its power to the ultimate conclusion of the protracted struggle between the saints and Satan with all his agents, Daniel identifies three significant events that serve as milestones along the path: The arrival of the Ancient of days, referring to the position Jehovah assumes in the commencement of the judgment scene described in verses 9 and 10.

original_text: During this time, the martyrs will judge the formidable persecuting power, which, in their days of tribulation, pursued them like desert beasts and spilled their blood like water.
